stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on programming and designing the overworld, including gating the first course, allocating save-flags, modelling the Pachyderm NPC, and brainstorming an intro cut-scene that repositions the player start. He also workshopped split-screen co-op performance and star-count scope.

development_findings.summary: Course 2 has been heavily bug-fixed off-stream and should be finished by the end of the week.
development_findings.quote: I've been doing a lot of work on course 2 off-stream… I think I'll be done with it by the end of the week.

development_findings.summary: The project has grown from a planned 185 stars to 193; Kaze expects to add about seven more overworld stars to reach a round number (≈200).
development_findings.quote: We started with a hack that had planned to have like 185 stars and now we have 193.

development_findings.summary: Overworld tasks listed: ‘bop to Bunny Brushwoods’, Pachyderm toll, temple door that opens after star collection, cannon warp, plus general star-gate scripting.
Initial plan to gate Course 1 with Pachyderm demanding 10 coins was reconsidered because testers felt it might feel like a chore.
development_findings.quote: I really, really want the player to collect 10 coins… That thought does make sense to me [that it’s a chore].

development_findings.summary: New idea: intro cut-scene where a Nap-E-Nut destroys Mario’s boat; Mario spawns in the water and swims to shore, encouraging immediate exploration without a coin toll.
development_findings.quote: My idea is… a Nap-E-Nut just munches your boat and Mario jumps off and lands in the water here.

development_findings.summary: Split-screen co-op is being prototyped: each player gets a half-resolution 16∶9 panel with side black bars; expected FPS drop from 30→20, deemed acceptable.
development_findings.quote: Multiplayer is probably going to drop an RSP on 30 FPS level to 20 FPS, but 20 FPS on the N64… is it that bad?

development_findings.summary: Dialogue freeze in co-op will switch the active player to full-screen; boss fights may swap control after hits; interactions will read the closest player’s state.
Save-flag space is being re-engineered: 17 overworld stars exceeded the existing 16-bit map; new ‘event flags’ will be stored in unused EEPROM filler.
development_findings.quote: We need to make new space for save flags in the EEP … These 16 bits are no good. … We don’t really have the main menu filler data.

development_findings.summary: Pachyderm 3-D model: started from a pear-shaped Pokémon Colosseum mesh, decimated to ~242 then 140 triangles for N64 limits.
Fast64 / Blender material bug forces Kaze to edit in Eevee mode, slowing workflow.
development_findings.quote: For some reason, this is just black when it really shouldn’t be… I’m switching back to Eevee even though it’s slow.

context_findings.summary: Kaze muses about only speaking objectively provable statements, referencing Immanuel Kant and Star Trek’s Vulcans.
context_findings.quote: I actually thought it would be a fun experiment to try and only say things in the way where they are objectively true.

context_findings.summary: Shows both excitement and fatigue: ‘finally getting to program the overworld feels crazy’ but ends stream feeling ‘pretty done for today’.
States neutral-to-positive stance on AI tools but feels social pressure to be ‘against AI’.
context_findings.quote: The problem is I need to be against AI or I will get lynched.

context_findings.summary: Mentions personal plan for laser eye surgery.
Notes undisclosed ‘legal issues’ around paying Biobak but assures payment will happen.
context_findings.quote: There are some legal issues right now, but don’t worry, he will be paid.

biobak.summary: Reworking a stage and the Yoshi gate texture; requested a smaller mission; provided feedback that the coin-toll gate might feel like a chore.

zeina.summary: Currently animating (e.g., ball-breaking scene) and participating in musical track selection during stream.

key_stories.title: Star-Count Scope Creep
key_stories.summary: The hack was planned for 185 stars but grew to 193. Kaze now aims for a rounded figure by inserting extra overworld stars.
key_stories.process: Tracked new stars, discussed adding seven overworld stars to balance total.
key_stories.outcome: Target star count tentatively set near 200; overworld design adjusted.
key_stories.key_quote: If we put every piece of content that we thought to put into the game into the game now, we would end up with 200 stars and 193 stars.

key_stories.title: Redesigning the Course 1 Gate
key_stories.summary: Initially, Pachyderm was to block Course 1 until players paid 10 coins, but concern over ‘chore’ led to a new Nap-E-Nut boat-crash intro.
key_stories.challenge: Need to encourage exploration without frustrating players.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed alternatives (TNT, boulder, Bob-omb), consulted Biobak, modelled Pachyderm, then pivoted to Nap-E-Nut cut-scene.
key_stories.outcome: New plan: cinematic boat attack introduces swimming, removes coin toll; Pachyderm will be used elsewhere.
key_stories.key_quote: If we don’t want Pachyderm blocking this… we need a different way to do it.

key_stories.title: Prototyping Split-Screen Co-op
key_stories.summary: Kaze examines feasibility of two-player split-screen on N64.
key_stories.challenge: Rendering two views risks severe FPS loss and complicates interactions.
key_stories.process: Proposed half-resolution 16∶9 panels, black side bars, reuse shared data, and logic for dialogues, bosses, and ‘closest player’ state.
key_stories.outcome: Believes 20 FPS is acceptable; co-op remains under consideration.
key_stories.key_quote: There is a good chance we can make a split-screen multiplayer work.
